content.text:
# 21st TCA Awards

The 21st TCA Awards were presented by the Television Critics Association. Craig Ferguson hosted the ceremony on July 23, 2005, at the Beverly Hilton Hotel.
Winners and nominees
{| class="wikitable"
|-
!width="220"|Category
!width="400"|Winner
!width="330"|Other Nominees
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Program of the Year
|align="center" | Desperate Housewives (ABC)
|
* Arrested Development (Fox)
* The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (Comedy Central)
* Deadwood (HBO)
* Lost (ABC)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Comedy
|align="center" | Arrested Development (Fox)
|
* The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (Comedy Central)
* Desperate Housewives (ABC)
* Everybody Loves Raymond (CBS)
* Gilmore Girls (The WB)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Drama
|align="center" | Lost (ABC)
|
* 24 (Fox)
* Deadwood (HBO)
* House (Fox)
* Rescue Me (FX)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Movies, Miniseries and Specials
|align="center" | The Office Special (BBC America)
|
* Lackawanna Blues (HBO)
* The Life and Death of Peter Sellers (HBO)
* Something the Lord Made (HBO)
* Sometimes in April (HBO)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding New Program of the Year
|align="center" | Lost (ABC)
|
* Desperate Housewives (ABC)
* House (Fox)
* Rescue Me (FX)
* Veronica Mars (UPN)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Individual Achievement in Comedy
|align="center" | Jon Stewart - The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (Comedy Central)
|
* Jason Bateman - Arrested Development (Fox)
* Marcia Cross - Desperate Housewives (ABC)
* Teri Hatcher - Desperate Housewives (ABC)
* Ray Romano - Everybody Loves Raymond (CBS)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Individual Achievement in Drama
|align="center" | Hugh Laurie - House (Fox)
|
* Kristen Bell - Veronica Mars (UPN)
* Matthew Fox - Lost (ABC)
* Ian McShane - Deadwood (HBO)
* Kiefer Sutherland - 24 (Fox)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in Children's Programming
|align="center" | Degrassi: The Next Generation (The N)
|
* Dora the Explorer (Nickelodeon)
* Nick News with Linda Ellerbee (Nickelodeon)
* Postcards from Buster (PBS)
* SpongeBob SquarePants (Nickelodeon)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Outstanding Achievement in News and Information
|align="center" | Frontline (PBS)
|
* 60 Minutes: Sunday Edition (CBS)
* The Daily Show with Jon Stewart (Comedy Central)
* Meet the Press (NBC)
* The News Hour with Jim Lehrer (PBS)
* Nightline (ABC)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Heritage Award
|align="center" | Nightline (ABC)
|
* Frontline (PBS)
* M*A*S*H (CBS)
* Saturday Night Live (NBC)
* Sesame Street (PBS)
|-
|align="center" style="background: #ececec; color: grey; vertical-align: middle; text-align: center;" class="table-na" | Career Achievement Award
|align="center" |
Bob Newhart
|
* No other nominees
|}
